info.headline: Freezing Fog Advisory issued February 07 at 10:45PM EST until February 08 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FREEZING FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Visibility 1 mile or less in freezing fog. * WHERE...In Virginia, Franklin, Henry, Pittsylvania, Buckingham, Halifax and Charlotte Counties. In North Carolina, Rockingham and Caswell Counties. * WHEN...Until 7 AM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility and potential frost on bridges, overpasses, and less traveled secondary roads as well as sidewalks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Moist ground, clearing skies above, and light or calm winds has promoted fog development. Temperatures are below freezing, mostly in the 20s. This will result in freezing fog which can result in the formation of a thin layer or ice or frost on roads, bridges, overpasses, and sidewalks.
info.instruction: If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you. Also, be alert for frost on bridge decks causing slippery roads.
